text: Mícheál Ó Muircheartaigh (; 20 August 1930 - 25 June 2024) was an Irish Gaelic games commentator for the Irish national radio and television, Raidió Teilifís. In a career that has lasted 60 years, he has come to be regarded as the "voice of Gaelic games." His prolific career has earned him a place in Guinness World Records."Legend Micheal takes lead to fulfil lifetime ambition". Irish Independent. Ó Muircheartaigh died at a hospital in Dublin, Ireland at the age of 93 on 25 June 2024. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1930 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Irish television presenters Category:Irish radio personalities
title: Mícheál Ó Muircheartaigh
